From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To set the number of data bits per character that are interpreted and generated by the Cisco IOS software, use the **data-character-bits** command in line configuration mode. To restore the default value, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Eight data bits per character. This is the default.

Examples: The following example sets the number of data bits per character to seven on virtual terminal line (vty) 1:
ExtraInfo: The **data-character-bits** line configuration command is used primarily to strip parity from X.25 connections on routers with the protocol translation software option. The **data-character-bits** line configuration command does not work on hard-wired lines.

RelatedCmds.description: Sets the number of data bits per character that are interpreted and generated by the Cisco IOS software for the current line and session.
